long_synopsis: Week 8 of Trump’s second term registered only a 0.2‑minute shift on the Democracy Clock, leaving the public time at 7:52 p.m., but the machinery behind the face changed markedly. Trump and Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency consolidated veto power over agencies, driving mass layoffs, lease closures, and program dismantling while inflating unverifiable “savings” and stripping transparency. Executive orders hollowed non‑statutory components of agencies, defunded the U.S. Agency for Global Media, and terminated diversity programs, politicizing civil service roles and weakening civil‑rights enforcement. Immigration and emergency powers were repurposed to end birthright citizenship, revive family detention, and target pro‑Palestinian activists, turning nationality and perceived allegiance into conditions for rights. Law enforcement and clemency increasingly shielded allies and punished critics, even as courts forced DOGE disclosures and blocked some cuts. Universities, environmental protections, and public‑health information came under coordinated pressure, while civil society mobilized protests and voting‑rights efforts that remained visible but structurally outpaced.
